snippet: In 2009 the first part of a formal Lincoln tribute opened at the renovated Ford’s Theater; now a 10-story Center for Education and Leadership is opening across the street.
abstract: Edward Rothstein reviews exhibits surveying life of President Lincoln at the Center for Education and Leadership, 10-story building opening across from the renovated Ford's Theater in Washington, DC.
lead_paragraph: In 2009 the first part of a formal Lincoln tribute opened at the renovated Ford’s Theater; now a 10-story Center for Education and Leadership is opening across the street.

headline.seo: Lincoln Museum at Expanded Ford’s Theater Complex
headline.main: Lincoln Museum, Act II, the Morning After the Death
